review_text: 3.5/5What do you like best about NetSuite?The ability to customize just about anything I do in the app. I can write Suitescript to perform a whole host of actions, including sending webhooks and communicating with other systems, create custom fields, custom formulas, build workflows with a no-code UI, etc. It is also quite comprehensive, performing anything from rev rec and billing to invoicing and subscription management Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.What do you dislike about NetSuite?Netsuite is not incredibly user-friendly. And when you want to do something complex, there are many times where the built-in workflow functionality just isn't enough. At that point you either need to pay a consultancy or use engineering resources to get things done. The cost is also substantial, though admittedly not much more expensive than even a newer, shinier service like Stripe for things like subscription management & billing. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.What problems is NetSuite solving and how is that benefiting you?Netsuite takes care of AR/AP for us quite straightforwardly. It also is a source of record for all customer invoicing and transactions, though it doesn't serve as a billing portal. We use it to do subscription management & billing for higher-revenue customers which it does a fine job of. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com. Show More

title: 5/5What do you like best about NetSuite?I have been working with NetSuite for ov...
review_text: 5/5What do you like best about NetSuite?I have been working with NetSuite for over 11 years. I enjoy that they seem to be updating the product and features continuously. Sometimes this creates a few hiccups, but overall they seem very prepared to take their customers with them as they modernize. I enjoy the ability to control so many aspects of my accounting system and the depths of their reporting capacity. The representatives we've worked with over the years have always been incredibly responsive so I believe you get what you pay for with this product. We use it every day and across office locations with ease. I was not there when we implemented NetSuite, but from what I know it was very easy. We have integrated several features on the years and it was always fairly seamless. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.What do you dislike about NetSuite?As I mentioned about updates, sometimes it can cause minor disruptions and it can happen quickly. When they deprecated 1099s that was a little stressful because we found out right before year end. However, in the end it was worth it because the program we got was even better. Just painful in the transition period. Also, there are some areas where I think the reporting and processes were built by IT professionals and not accountants. I'm sure they're tired of hearing that, since us accountants can appear to be giant complainers. The reporting is so complex that sometimes it's hard to know what format to start with when you want to do something. Also, we ran into an issue where two features combined do not give us the result promised (income statement with all active accounts, including zero balances but not inactive accounts). We have been through their service desk and no one seems to understand why it doesn't produce that right information and keeps including inactive accounts in the final report. Lastly, support is incredibly helpful but be prepared to deal with time zone issues and potentially timing issues.
